form.PN:
samostalnik, pridevnik ali predlog izgovarjamo
/s*VbdZI2kt/
, glagol pa
/s*@bdZ*ekt/
.

sense.def:
The subject of a conversation, letter, or book
je tisto, o čemer teče beseda v pogovoru, pismu ali knjigi.

seg.quote: I don't have any strong views on the subject.
However much you try to change the subject, the conversation invariably returns to politics.

sense.def:
The subject of a clause
je v slovnici tista samostalniška besedna zveza, s katero poimenujemo osebo ali stvar, ki izvaja dejanje, izraženo s povedkom.

A subject
je tudi na primer kemija, zgodovina ali angleščina, ki se je učimo v šoli ali na univerzi.

seg.quote: Maths was my best subject at school.

sense.def:
The subjects of a country
so ljudje, ki živijo v neki državi;

Kadar so ljudje
subject
, jih nadzoruje vlada ali vladar. Kadar so države
subject
, jih nadzoruje druga država.

seg.quote: ...freedom for the subject peoples of the world.

sense.def:
To be subject to something
pomeni soditi pod določena pravila ali zakone ali nagnjen k nečemu.

seg.quote: Your profit will be subject to tax.
He is highly strung and, therefore, subject to heart attacks.

sense.def:
Kadar se bo ena stvar zgodila
subject to another
, se bo zgodila le pod pogojem, da se zgodi nekaj drugega.

seg.quote: The property will be sold subject to the following conditions.

sense.def:
To subject someone to something unpleasant
pomeni poskrbeti, da nekdo doživi nekaj neprijetnega.

seg.quote: He was subjected to the harshest possible punishment.
